meanings.definition: In a way that relates to deep inward feelings rather than to the intellect.
meanings.sent1: She felt viscerally afraid of the dark, her heart racing with fear.
meanings.sent2: He viscerally understood the pain of losing a loved one.
meanings.sent3: The idea of eating bugs viscerally disgusted her, making her shudder.
meanings.sent4: The haunting melody of the song viscerally touched her soul.
meanings.sent5: The image of the abandoned puppy left a viscerally sad impression on her mind.

meanings.definition: In a way that is instinctive or deeply felt.
meanings.sent1: His decision to help the injured bird was viscerally driven by compassion.
meanings.sent2: She viscerally knew that something was wrong before anyone else did.
meanings.sent3: The smell of freshly baked cookies viscerally reminded him of his childhood.
meanings.sent4: The sound of thunder viscerally triggered her fear of storms.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the sunset was viscerally beautiful, stirring emotions within her.

meanings.definition: In a way that affects the internal organs.
meanings.sent1: The roller coaster ride made her feel viscerally nauseous.
meanings.sent2: The news of the accident viscerally shocked her, causing her stomach to churn.
meanings.sent3: The pungent smell of the cheese viscerally made her gag.
meanings.sent4: The intense workout left him feeling viscerally exhausted.
meanings.sent5: The bitter taste of the medicine was viscerally unpleasant, making her grimace.
